member.summary: Attempts to parse using the date formatting information specified by the settings, as well as the reverse Month-Day order.
member.param: The parser settings to use when parsing.
member.returns: True if a DateTime value was successfully parsed.

member.name: M:Sovren.DateParser2.GetSingleYMDDate(System.String)
member.summary: Pass only the numeric date part as a single word. Just "060504", not "allianace 060504 for smarter business"
member.returns: Valid DateFound, or null if no valid date found.

member.name: M:Sovren.DateParser2.NormalizeDates(Sovren.ParserSettings,System.String)
member.summary: Normalize dates to formats that are easier to parse. Remove ordinal text such as "1st", "2nd", "3rd", "4th". Remove connector words such as "4 of July" or "5 de Mayo" Remove ordinal/connector combinations such as "4th of July". Replace missing spaces such as "26june". Replace missing spaces such as "26june". Handle all languages.
member.param: Text containing dates to be normalized.
member.returns: A string without ordinal text.
member.remarks:
This method is optimized for processing the entire resume in one shot. It will not be efficient if you call it repeatedly for each line of text. In batches, this method runs in less than 1 ms per resume (as of 2009-08-15).
Known issues:
Removes trailing period for languages that use "." for ordinal text "xx Maerz 2. xx" --> "xx Maerz 2 xx"
Removes ordinals in normal sentences "Finished the project on the 3rd of June." --> "on the 3 June."

member.name: M:Sovren.DateParser2.GetDuration(Sovren.ParserSettings,System.String,System.Int32@,Sovren.DateParser2.DurationType@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the value of a duration such as "10 months" or "20 weeks". DOES NOT get the value of the elapsed time between two discrete dates such as "05/2010 - 07/2010".

member.name: M:Sovren.DateParser2.NormalizeEndDate(Sovren.ParserSettings,Sovren.hrxmlFlexibleDatesType)
member.summary: When EndDate is YearOnly and same as RevisionDate.Year, then set the EndDate to be the same as the RevisionDate.

member.name: M:Sovren.DateParser2.NormalizeEndDate(Sovren.ParserSettings,Sovren.DateFound)
member.summary: When EndDate is YearOnly and same as RevisionDate.Year, then set the EndDate to be the same as the RevisionDate.

member.name: M:Sovren.DateParser2.NormalizeEndDate(Sovren.ParserSettings,System.DateTime)
member.summary: When EndDate > RevisionDate, set EndDate = RevisionDate. This method is not very intelligent, because DateTime object does not hold enough information to know when to adjust EndDate, so only call this method when you know the EndDate needs to be adjusted by RevisionDate.

summary.para: This class holds all of the language-dependent data lists used for parsing.

At runtime, the non-English lists are merged with the English lists to created the actual lists that are used by the parser. If you make changes to any of the lists, call in order for your changes to be made available to the parser.

remarks.para: English is treated as an Invariant language. All other languages incorporate the English lists into their parsing. In some cases, a non-English list is empty and you may find a mixture of languages within the English list. For example, a person who went to school in Germany but goes to work in the UK will commonly use German terms to describe his Education History, such as schools and degree names. For that reason, degree names are consolidated into the English (invariant) list.

member.name: M:Sovren.DataLists.LoadDefaults
member.summary: Call this method to invalidate any changes you have made to the data lists and revert back to the default values.

member.name: M:Sovren.DataLists.CommitChanges
member.summary: Call this method after changing any of the DataLists. The parser needs to update internal tables and does not track every change that you make, so you need to call this method to commit your changes to all the necessary places for the next parse transaction to see your data.

The key does not exist.

member.name: T:Sovren.TaxonomyCacheFactory
member.summary: This factory class is intended for use by COM clients to access the singleton instance of the TaxonomyCache class.

summary.para: This class caches custom taxonomies and skills. Multiple taxonomies and skills lists are cached independently. When new combinations of these lists are requested, a new cache root is created. When these lists are loaded from files, the files are monitored for changes and the lists are automatically refreshed from the files.
This class is thread safe.

member.name: M:Sovren.Int2List.MergeOverlapsAndContiguous(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reduces the number of items in the list by eliminating partial matches and concatenating adjacent items separated by a maximum allowable gap. Side effect: List is sorted by Integer1.
member.param: If the distance (not necessarily the alphanumeric character count) between two items is less than this value, then the items will be merged.

member.name: M:Sovren.Int2List.MergeOverlapsAndContiguous(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Reduces the number of items in the list by eliminating partial matches and concatenating adjacent items separated by a maximum allowable gap. Side effect: List is sorted by Integer1.
member.param: If the number of characters between adjacent items is less than this value, then the adjacent items will be merged.
When true, a gap is disqualified if it contains alphanumeric characters. When false, the gap can contain any characters.
The text that these offsets and lengths are found within.

member.name: M:Sovren.Int2List.MergeContiguousOnly(System.String,System.Int32,System.String[])
member.summary: Reduces the number of items in the list by concatenating adjacent items separated by a maximum allowable gap but not by any specified breaker. Side effect: List is sorted by Integer1.
member.param: If the number of characters between adjacent items is less than this value, then the adjacent items will be merged.
Presence of any of these between items will prevent their merge.

member.name: M:Sovren.Int2List.MergeContiguous(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Reduces the number of items in the list by concatenating adjacent items separated by any one of the specified connectors. Side effect: List is sorted by Integer1.
member.param: Presence of any of these between items will allow them to be merged.

member.name: T:Sovren.rrResConst
member.summary:
Holds constants and lookup lists used in resume parsing.
This class is (essentially) static and sealed, and contains a static class constructor that sorts any arrays in the correct order before they are ever used.
ARRAY SORT ORDER IS EXTREMELY IMPORTANT FOR BOTH PERFORMANCE AND ACCURACY.
For instance, STATE arrays must be sorted alphabetically because they are used in Array.BinarySearch() calls.
Other arrays are used in RrLib1.GetArray...() calls and therefore should be sorted by length descending.
Other arrays should NEVER be sorted because they are used to find the FIRST instance of a matching term and the order of the array terms has been tuned for accuracy. COMPANY_WORDS would be an example of a NEVER-SORT array.

member.name: P:Sovren.TaxonomyRootCollection.IncludeBuiltinRoots
member.summary:
When true, this collection will lazy load the built-in Sovren TaxonomyRoot(s) for the language that is being parsed. This is useful when creating custom collections and you don't want to load the language-specific version in advance.
Default = false.

member.name: P:Sovren.TaxonomyRootCollection.TaxonomySubset
member.summary:
Specify the subset of Taxonomies within this collection to include during skills parsing. If none are specified, then all Taxonomies are included. For each specified Taxonomy, all of its subtaxonomies will also be included.
Default = empty.
Key: Id of the TaxonomyRoot object.
Value: Id of a Taxonomy within the specified TaxonomyRoot.
Value of null (or empty list) indicates use of all taxonomies within the TaxonomyRoot.
Value of TaxonomyCollection.ALL_TAXONOMIES ("+ALL+") indicates use of all taxonomies within the TaxonomyRoot.

remarks.para: The number of skills that are available as potential matches can run to the tens or hundreds of thousands. The more skills there are in the "match to" lists, the longer it will take to parse. In many cases, the applicant's primary skills area can be discovered in advance, providing the opportunity to use just the subset of the total skills lists for parsing. If this property is left null, then all Taxonomies are included during parsing.

member.name: T:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties
member.summary:
This unit is intended to show you how to extract data from the parser after parsing.
Several useful Sovren utility methods are also demonstrated here.
This unit is available in source code form by request.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughParserOutput(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: Walk through commonly used parts of the parser output.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughName(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: This is how you extract the candidate's name.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughEmailAddressesAndURLs(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: This is how you extract the candidate's email address(es) and personal webpage.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughPostalAddresses(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: This is how you extract the candidate's postal address(es). Candidates may have more than one address.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughPhones(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: This is how you get the candidate's phone info. DO NOT USE any other method.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughWorkHistory(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: This is how you iterate through the candidate's job history and pull out the data job-by-job.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughPersonalData(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: We can parse for a LOT of personal data. This is how to access that data after parsing, assuming you turned that type of parsing on in the parser configuration. There are regulatory and legal issues surrounding this data, and you need to be careful that you do not capture data that is not in compliance with your locale's governance.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughEducation(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: This is how you iterate through the candidate's educational history and pull out the school/degree history one by one.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughLanguages(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: This is how you can get the foreign language data, if you have set the parser to parse for that.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughSkills(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: This is how you get to the skills data, skill by skill.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughCertificationsAndLicenses(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: This is how you access license and certification data, if you have enabled that in the parser.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.WalkThroughReferences(Sovren.ParserMapper)
member.summary: This is how to access data on references. The HR-XML Resume 2_4 schema does not have a place for Employer name, unfortunately....

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.ConvertPhoneToJustNumbers(System.String)
member.summary: This shows how to use the RrLib1.LeaveJustIntegers() method to take a string such as a phone number and strip out everything other than the digits. Thus, "(505) 678-0987" would be returned as "5056780987".

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.LoadMyFileIntoAByteArray(System.String)
member.summary: This shows using the FileHelper.ReadAllBytes method for loading a diskfile into a byte array. This byte array can then be passed to the DoConversion() method of the Sovren Document Converter. The advantage of this method over is that this method can read files that are currently open by other applications like Microsoft Word.
member.param: Pathname for file to be loaded.
member.returns: A byte array containing the contents of the file. If file does not exist, then an empty array is returned.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.LoadStringIntoByteArray(System.String)
member.summary: This method shows how to load a string into a byte array. You have to know what kind of encoding you want to use. A Unicode encoding such as UTF-8 is usually the best option.
member.param: The string to be loaded into the byte array.
member.returns: The string encoded in UTF-8 format.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.StripOutCharactersThatCauseXMLAndSoapToRejectTheData(System.String)
member.summary: Certain characters, such as control characters, cause an otherwise valid XML string to be unusable in SOAP calls, and in loading and validating the XML. This method shows how to use the RrLib1.CleanTextForSoapTransport() method to clean out bad xml data. IF YOU EVER GET XML ERRORS WORKING WITH Sovren XML output (and you never should...), this method can be applied to the data to fix it.
member.param: The XML data to be cleaned. DO NOT pass binary data!
member.returns: A cleaned string with no XML-invalid characters.

member.name: M:Sovren.WalkingTheObjectProperties.ChangeDataInAParserDataArrayBeforeParsing
member.summary:
There are hundreds of public data lists (see DataLists class), and all of those lists are user-modifiable at runtime. Changing the data in these arrays will affect the output of the Parser. For instance, changing the data in the COMPANY_NAME_EXCEPTIONS list will affect the recognition of company names that are unrecognizable (usually because they were thought up by some marketing firm). So, if "BGUP" is a company, and the Parser is not recognizing it as a company, then you could change COMPANY_NAME_EXCEPTIONS to include "BGUP", and the Parser would then find BGUP as a company.
These changes are global, meaning that all instances of the Parser will use the new data. Of course, that does not mean that **after you bring the app down**, the new data is somehow "saved" and reused. These changes are in-memory only.

member.name: T:Sovren.TaxonomyMap
member.summary:
TaxonomyMap is a class to hold mappings from Sovren's built-in taxonomy to a user's internal taxonomy, while still using Sovren's taxonomy for parsing.
A Sovren TaxonomyId can map to just one user Taxonomy Id. If a subsequent entry is added for a given SovrenTaxonomyId, then that entry will overwrite the first entry.
When there is no mapping provided for a given Sovren Taxonomy Id, then the User Taxonomy Id and Taxonomy Name are assumed to be the same as the Sovren ones.
NOTE: If the user uses his own custom taxonomy for parsing, there is no need for a map, as the taxonomy IDs and Names would already match what he was expecting.

member.returns: The corresponding User Taxonomy Id

member.param: The User Taxonomy Id for which a User Taxonomy Name should be returned.
member.returns: The corresponding User Taxonomy Name. DOES NOT return the Sovren Taxonomy Name if the User Taxonomy Id is not in the provided User mappings.

member.name: T:Sovren.SafeStopwatch
member.summary: Similar to System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch except that this class uses a timer that is more reliable but has a lower resolution (approximately 10-16 ms). On Windows Vista and later (version >= 6.0), the time span is unlimited. On versions of Windows prior to Vista (version < 6.0), the time span is limited to 49.7 days.
member.remarks:
The standard System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch class has the following problems:
When IsHighResolution is false, the system clock is used and is subject to changes by users, the Windows Time service, and underlying virtual machine hosts.
When IsHighResolution is true, either a processor clock or chipset clock is used depending on the hardware. If a processor clock is used, problems will occur due to variable frequencies due to CPU power management or due to clock drift between multiple processors, which could yield wildly inaccurate elapsed times that in some cases may be negative. If a chipset clock (HPET) is used (available on circa 2005 or later chipsets and only supported by Windows Vista or later), then it works well in physical hardware environments but may act as a processor-based clock in virtualized environments such as Amazon EC2 64-bit due to bugs in the virtualization drivers.
These problems with the standard Stopwatch class cannot be avoided or worked around, so the SafeStopwatch class should be used in scenarios where reliability is more important than resolution.

member.name: M:Sovren.SafeStopwatch.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance.

member.name: M:Sovren.SafeStopwatch.Reset
member.summary: Stops time interval measurement and resets the elapsed time to zero.

member.name: M:Sovren.SafeStopwatch.Start
member.summary: Starts, or resumes, measuring elapsed time for an interval.

member.name: M:Sovren.SafeStopwatch.StartNew
member.summary: Initializes a new instance, sets the elapsed time property to zero, and starts measuring elapsed time.
member.returns: An instance that has just begun measuring elapsed time.

member.name: M:Sovren.SafeStopwatch.Stop
member.summary: Stops measuring elapsed time for an interval.

member.summary: Gets the total elapsed time measured by the current instance.
member.value: A read-only System.TimeSpan representing the total elapsed time measured by the current instance.

member.summary: Gets the total elapsed time measured by the current instance, in milliseconds.
member.value: A read-only long integer representing the total number of milliseconds measured by the current instance.

member.name: P:Sovren.SafeStopwatch.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the timer is running.
member.value: true if the instance is currently running and measuring elapsed time for an interval; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Sovren.WorkHistorySubSection.GetOverlap(Sovren.WorkHistoryFragment,Sovren.WorkHistoryFragment,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String@,Sovren.RrLib1.OverlapType@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Checks for overlap between two fragments, and reports where the overlap is in each fragment. Order of frag1 and frag2 does not matter.
member.param: It may be that the text positions of the two fragments are non-overlapping YET they contain some of the same text. In this case, if this parameter is true, then we will check, using just the text in the fragments, to see if there is a partial overlap at start or end, or if all of one fragment's text is contained within the other's.
If true, then we will check for one of the strings being contained within the other, but not at the start or end. Example: "aaa bbb ccc" and "bbb".
One of the RrLib1.OverlapType enumerations, describing the nature/position of the overlap.
Offset relative to first character position of frag1 text is zero.
Offset relative to first character position of frag1 text is zero.
Offset relative to first character position of frag2 text is zero.
Offset relative to first character position of frag2 text is zero.

member.name: T:Sovren.SovrenResumeParser
member.summary: SovrenResumeParser extends TxtParser's resume parsing functionality by adding Skills matching and an expanded Xml export (neither of which are used by the HR-XML parser, which has its own implementation of these features). This parser is the basic Contact Info parser. The HR-XML parsers use a completed instance of this parser.

member.name: T:Sovren.TxtParser
member.summary:
TxtParser is a generic parser for extracting contextual information from text files. It is primarily a Contact Info parser.
HIERARCHY: rrParser => TxtParser ==> SovrenResumeParser.
RECOMMENDATION: Do not use this class. Use the SovrenResumeParser instead.

member.name: M:Sovren.TxtParser.AddOtherPhonesIfIndicated
member.summary: Phones may appear in more than one place in a resume, especially with job board resumes. We need to look for all the places known candidate phone numbers appear, and make sure we have any additional adjacent phones as well. For example, see "C:\resumes\20050711\ChristineBradley.html".

member.name: M:Sovren.TxtParser.ParseContactInfoNEW(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This is the core method that extracts contact info.
From a pure coding standpoint, it could use refactoring. However, this code has been tested through many many years and it works well. As you can see, the code is rather procedural, and that's why we've left it as is. Parsing itself is a procedural, sequential programming exercise. You have to do each thing in order; you can't spawn off new threads and start doing multiple things. So, this method, though long, will remain as is, with the occasional tweak.
The best way to understand this code, and to determine where changes could be made, is to walk through it in the debugger using watch variables for the values such as FirstName, LastName, City, etc.
Contact info parsing is normally seen as an exercise in writing regular expressions. We disagree. The code that follows does not use regular expressions to do its work, and it is far, far more accurate and flexible and maintainable and understandable than anything that could be accomplished with regular expressions. The way we identify person names is just magic. It uses a lot of Bayesian tests and a lot of pattern matching and a lot of positional hints to find the names, and it does it really well.
There is only one voting algorithm in here, and that is used in the determination of the street address. Everything else is done without voting.

member.name: M:Sovren.TxtParser.CheckAgainForPhoneTypes
member.summary: Sometimes phones appear in more than one place in the resume. If so, the phone type may not always appear in each place, so we need to check for missing phone types.

member.summary: Assumes max two words can be removed.

member.name: M:Sovren.TxtParser.CollapseLinesBasedOnTrailingColon(System.String)

member.name: M:Sovren.TxtParser.ParseAsBlind(Sovren.TStringList,Sovren.Int2List,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
THIS IS THE CORE CONTACT INFO PARSING ROUTINE IN THE ENTIRE SOVREN NAMESPACE.
This routine is very long and procedural for several reasons. The primary reason is that we want to put all of the flow and logic of finding Contact Info in one routine. It is insufficient to just have a collection of routines that each find a single type of data. The location and identification of each piece of data needs to be done in a way that is contextually aware, and that contextual awareness needs to happen in a very procedural fashion. Certain pieces of data can be extracted more accurately only when other pieces have been identified and extracted before them. DO NOT refactor this method, as to do so will destroy the ability to read and maintain the code as a logical, cohesive, procedural flow.
member.param: The lines of text that will be parsed. These lines need to be explicitly passed, because we cannot assume that that it is the total resume that should be parsed.

It is possible to pass a structure containing far more lines than the subset of lines that are of interest for Contact Info parsing. It is less costly to pass the full existing 'lines' object and a designator to define the lines of interest, than it would be to create a new 'lines' object containing just the subset of the lines with only the lines of interest included.

"Depth Control" is an important concept to reduce the appearance of false positives. Here's a typical scenario: A resume has only a Candidate Name, Phone Number, and Email Address at the top, immediately followed by a short Job Objective and then by a Work History section. In that first job, the name of the Employer is followed by the employer's address. Without "depth control" to limit how "deep" we can go to find contact info, what would happen is that we would falsely pull the company contact info into the candidate's contact info.
The logical question, then, is why would we ever NOT want to have depth control. The answer is that there are some scenarios in which depth control is not needed and could in fact arbitrarily limit us from finding the last bit of real data that we need. Primarily, this would be a scenario in which we are parsing a subset of lines at the end of the resume that we think contain a reference with the refence's contact info. We may need to go a line or two "deeper" than the limit of, say, 12 lines, that would be the restriction imposed by using depth control. So, in those cases we would probably use depth control.
If true, data will not be sanity checked, meaning incomplete or improper data may remain.

member.name: M:Sovren.DllHelper.ExtractLibrary(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Extracts a built-in library to a temp directory and returns the path of the extracted library.
member.remarks: The current implementation extracts libraries once per machine, once per version to a temp folder named like this: %TEMP%\sov-6.2.1067.0 This avoids the overhead of extracting them each time. The libraries are stored in a zipped resource, to minimize the size of the assembly. The initialization overhead per machine per version is about 100-200 ms. The initialization overhead per application instance (AppDomain) is about 1 ms. The initialization overhead per DocumentConverter instance is virtually non existent.
member.returns: Path of the extracted library.

member.name: T:Sovren.ParserMapper
member.summary: ParserMapper is the class that performs HR-XML parsing, using a "completed" instance of a SovrenResumeParser. The parsed results are available via an output parameter, return parameter, or by reading the Resume property.
member.remarks:
Parsing is performed by two different objects:
1) Basic parsing is performed by an instance of the SovrenResumeParser class.
2) HR-XML (detailed) parsing is performed by an instance of this ParserMapper
class. The ParserMapper instance uses a completed instance of a
SovrenResumeParser, and then performs more detailed parsing. The results
are available as an HR-XML Resume 2.4-compliant object or text string.

member.name: M:Sovren.ParserMapper.#ctor(Sovren.ParserSettings)
member.summary: Create a new instance of the parser using the specified settings. If you are using COM, then first create an instance of ParserFactory and then call to create a new instance of this class.

remarks.para: The ParserSettings instance passed to this constructor is cloned and made available by the read-only property. The parser uses the clone and will not be aware of any changes made to your original settings object. Consequently:

list.item: You must make all settings changes before calling this constructor.
You can reuse your ParserSettings instance for multiple ParserMapper instances.

remarks.para: Also please note that the Settings property may be internally modified during parsing to add or change settings according to information learned about the resume that is being parsed (such as automatic language detection). These changes will be reflected in the Settings property but will not change the ParserSettings object that you created. After parsing, you may access these changes on the Settings property of your ParserMapper instance.
Here are the steps for parsing:

list.item: Configure that ParserSettings instance by setting its properties.

Instantiate a ParserMapper instance using this constructor and pass your ParserSettings instance to this constructor. Any settings changes you make after this step will be ignored by this parser instance.
Access the parser results on and .

member.param: The settings to use during parsing. Cannot be null. The settings are cloned and a read-only copy is made available by the property. Changes made to this object after the constructor will be ignored by this parser instance.

The order of processing here is the recommended order, based on subjective judgments regarding relative importance.

member.summary: Creates a thread, wraps the delegate with an exception handler, sets the new thread to match the current thread's priority, then starts the thread.
member.param: The method that does the actual work.
member.returns: A started worker thread

member.name: M:Sovren.ParserMapper.ProcessSummaries
member.summary: Extracts ExecutiveSummary and QualificationsSummary and populates the Resume object.

summary.para: Private.
Parses only some sections, as in W.H. and Skills and Qualif. Summary and Cover Letter.

NOTE: If "SkipSkillsParsing = false", but there is no TaxonomySource defined, the TaxonomySource will automatically be set to use the default Sovren Skills Taxonomy. However, in that case, the skills taxonomy will be instantiated only for this one Parser instance, and this will cause performance to suffer. Instead, be sure to always instantiate the skills taxonomy (TaxonomyCollection) independently of the Parser, and assign your instantiated skills taxonomy instance to the Parser's own TaxonomySource property. That way, you can allow the skills taxonomy to survive beyond the life of a single Parser instance, allowing it to be reused, and thereby increasing performance/throughput.

Also, be sure to specify which taxonomies to parse for using the AddTaxonomyToParserFor() method of this class; otherwise, the Parser will default to all skills lists in all taxonomies in the entire TaxonomySource object!

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserMapper.MappingsOfSovrenTaxonomiesToUserFunctionalAreas
member.summary:
The Parser has a default mapping system for mapping Sovren Taxonomies to user functional areas used by SAP. If a user is defining her own taxonomies, or her own categories, or her own mappings, then this object will need to be constructed and populated by the user. The default value of this object is null, meaning that the Parser will use the Sovren defaults.
NOTE: This object is irrelevant if Settings.Coverage.JobCategories = false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserMapper.MappingsOfSovrenTaxonomiesToUserJobHierarchies
member.summary:
The Parser has a default mapping system for mapping Sovren Taxonomies to user job hierarchy levels used by SAP. If a user is defining her own taxonomies, or her own job hierarchies, or her own mappings, then this object will need to be constructed and populated by the user. The default value of this object is null, meaning that the Parser will use the Sovren defaults.
NOTE: This object is irrelevant if Settings.Coverage.JobCategories = false.

member.name: T:Sovren.Broadlook.DocumentType

member.name: T:Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCapture
member.summary: Through a partnership with Broadlook, this ContactCapture class (along with the 32-bit only blccsov32.dll and broadfl.dll files) provides a mechanism for Sovren customers to very quickly capture multiple contacts from a non-resume documents, such as a contact list from a company web site. This component is not nearly as thorough or accurate as the ParserMapper component at extracting contact information from resumes, and it is not able to distinguish between candidate, reference, job board, or recruiter contact information, so it is not recommended for parsing resumes.

member.name: M:Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCapture.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCapture.Capture(System.String,Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCaptureSettings)
member.summary: Capture contact information from a text document.
member.param: The document text to be examined. Can be text, html, csv (see ).
Settings that control the capture behavior.
member.returns: A strongly-typed object containing all of the captured data. Can be serialized to XML by calling GetAsXml().
member.exception: Thrown when an unrecoverable error condition occurs.

member.name: M:Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCapture.DoCapture(System.String,Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCaptureSettings,System.String@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Do the main parsing work.
member.param: The settings that control the parse behavior.
The xml if one or more contacts is found or an error occurs. Empty if no contacts are found.
When true, the capture is retried a second time to workaround intermittent data corruption.
member.returns: 0 if no contacts found, in which case the xml parameter is empty. Less than 0 if an error occurred, in which case the xml parameter contains an ErrorMessage element. Otherwise, the number of contacts found, in which case the xml contains all the data elements.

member.name: T:Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCaptureException
member.summary: This type of exception is thrown whenever an error occurs within .

member.summary: This class holds all of the configuration options for ContactCapture.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: P:Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCaptureSettings.DocumentType
member.summary: The type of document being processed (text, html, csv). Default = DocumentType.Text

member.name: P:Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCaptureSettings.IncludeContext
member.summary: Include values for Context, ContextPre and ContextPost in the results. Default = false

member.name: P:Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCaptureSettings.MaxContacts
member.summary: Maximum number of contacts to be returned. Set to 0 for no limit. Default = 0.

member.name: P:Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCaptureSettings.RequireContactMethod
member.summary: When true, a contact will only be returned if it contains at least one method of contact such as an email, phone, postal address or website. When false, all possible contacts are returned, although there will often be some false positives that contain only a person name or CompanyName. Default = true

member.name: P:Sovren.Broadlook.ContactCaptureSettings.Sort
member.summary: When true, contacts are sorted by name. When false, contacts are reported in the same order as they appear in the original document. Default = false

member.summary: Holds all of the data returned by .

member.summary: Holds all the data for a single contact returned by .

member.name: M:Sovren.RrLib1.GetOriginalPunctuatedString(System.String,System.String,Sovren.RrLib1.MatchOptions)
member.summary: Given a search term and a chunk of text, this function finds the first matching term in the text, but it does so in a fashion that matches only the alphanumeric characters and ignores all punctuation, spaces, etc. Thus the search term "John Q Smith" can be found as "John Q. Smith" in the text -- and vice versa.
member.param: An array of MatchOptions such as WholeWordsOnly.
member.returns: The matched term, with all attached punctuation, etc., in the text.

member.name: M:Sovren.RrLib1.GetOriginalPunctuatedString(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Sovren.RrLib1.MatchOptions)

Smith" in the text -- and vice versa.
member.param: The position within SearchIn to begin searching.
An array of MatchOptions such as WholeWordsOnly.
member.returns: The matched term, with all attached punctuation, etc., in the text.

member.name: T:Sovren.ParserSettings
member.summary: Settings used by an instance of the parser.

remarks.para: Each parser instance gets its own copy of the default settings. These settings can be modified for that single parser instance, or a new ParserSettings object can be created and then cloned and assigned to the Settings property on one or more parser instances. Do not share a single settings instance among multiple parsers.

WARNING: Using the same settings object for multiple parsers may yield unexpected results. Settings within the Culture and Data settings groups may be changed by the parser due to Language/Culture auto-detection.
WARNING: Changing a settings object that is currently in use by a parser may yield unexpected results.

member.param: Only exists to create a distinct private constructor signature.

member.summary: Creates a new instance that is a deep copy of this instance and that is read-only.
member.returns: New read-only instance that contains an independent deep copy of the settings.

member.name: M:Sovren.ParserSettings.GetSettingsObject(System.String)
member.summary: ParserSettings factory method.
member.param: A string of characters where each character represents the value of a setting. See Remarks section for full details.
member.returns: A ParserSettings instance, configured as instructed.

remarks.para: A string of characters where each character represents the value of a setting. For most settings, a value of '0' means false and '1' means true. If the character is not one of the allowed values, then it is ignored and a default value is applied. If you only want to modify a few settings, then create a string of the desired length filled with spaces or dashes and only assign values to the desired settings positions.
These parameters retain backward compatibility with older versions of Sovren software, which is why some of the names are quirky, such as the double-negative pattern of SkipXxxx = false.
Those parameters, in order are:

item.description: Obsolete. SkipDateOfBirthParsing (0 = parse, 1 = skip [default]). The ParseDateOfBirth (position 42) setting takes precedence if string is at least 42 characters long.
Obsolete/ignored. Parsing of Affiliations is now controlled by position 11, SkipAssociationsParsing.
Obsolete/ignored. Parsing of Organizations is now controlled by position 11, SkipAssociationsParsing.
MaxThreadsPerParse (Default = 1. A value of zero means set equal to number of processors.)

member.name: M:Sovren.ParserSettings.ApplyConfiguration(System.String)
member.summary: Applies the settings from a configuration string to this instance. When the string specifies use of default values, the existing values in this instance are used.
member.param: See for a detailed specification of this configuration string.

member.name: M:Sovren.ParserSettings.ToConfigurationString
member.summary: Generate a configuration string representation of this object. Obsolete settings are output as '_'.
member.returns: Parser configuration string

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserSettings.Current
member.summary: Holds the current thread-local instance of ParserSettings.
member.exception: When value is null. If this ever occurs, it is a bug.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserSettings.DataLists
member.summary: Retrieves the object for Culture.Language setting. This value is automatically updated whenever then Language changes.

summary.para: Holds the default values that are supplied to new instances of ParserSettings.

WARNING: This property is a singleton instance that is intended to be configured at an application-level. DO NOT modify this single instance per transaction. Instead, create a new ParserSettings() instance to customize settings for an individual transaction.

The motivation for using this Default object is to override the default settings that will be automatically applied to all subsequent new ParserSettings instances at creation. So, if you wished to set Achievements to 'false' for all new instances of ParserSettings, you would do this:
THEN, for each parsing transaction you would write:
summary.code: ParserSettings settings = new ParserSettings(); ParserMapper parser = new ParserMapper(settings);
summary.para: But NEVER EVER use the ParserSettings.Default object as your actual per-transaction ParserSettings object, because it is static (persistent, singleton) and will cause unintended consequences.

member.summary: This class specifies all culture-related settings used during parsing.

member.name: M:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.GetCultures
member.summary: Returns a list of cultures that can be enabled/disabled.
member.returns: The list of supported cultures.
member.remarks: The list items are in English to make it easy for our English-speaking customers to map these items directly to a user interface control.

member.name: M:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.UseCultures(System.String[])
member.summary: Enable one or more cultures. This convenience method is intended to help with user interface integration so you can put the values into a ComboBox (or other controls) and then easily set the selected value, without needing to change code everytime Sovren adds support for a new culture.
member.param: One of the values in the list.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.AutoDetect
member.summary: When true, the parser analyzes the text and automatically determines the best match Culture, including Language, CultureInfo and RegionInfo. When true, the Language property sets the corresponding UseFrance/UseGerman/etc. property. When false, all culture settings are left as assigned prior to parsing. Default = true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.Language
member.summary: The language to be used for parsing. If set to then the text will be automatically analyzed to determine the language. See for more details. Default = .

remarks.para: If is true, then when Language is set to:

item.description: Dutch: UseNetherlands is also set to true.
French: UseFrance is also set to true.
German: UseGerman is also set to true.
Greek: UseGreece is also set to true.
Hungarian: UseHungary is also set to true.
Italian: UseItaly is also set to true.
Russian: UseRussia is also set to true.
Spanish: UseSpain and UseArgentina are NOT also set to true.
Swedish: UseSweden is also set to true.
Norwegian: UseNorway is also set to true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.AlwaysFindInternationalPhones
member.summary: Determines whether the parser will locate only USA phone numbers or all other International phone numbers. Setting any of the UseCountry flags also explicitly sets this setting to true. The default is true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.UseGermany
member.summary: Set this property to true to enable parsing of CVs from Germany and other German-speaking countries. The default is false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.UseAustralia
member.summary: Set this property to true to enable parsing of Australia contact info. The default is false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.UseArgentina
member.summary: Set this property to true to enable parsing of Argentina contact info. The default is false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.UseFrance
member.summary: Set this property to true to enable parsing of France contact info. The default is false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.UseGreece
member.summary: Set this property to true to enable parsing of Greece contact info. The default is false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.UseSpain
member.summary: This switch is intended to allow very Spain-centric parsing that makes assumptions about the data that are normally not made. For instance, all names will be split into multi-word last names and there will be single or multi-word first names, but no middle names. Also, there are certain assumptions that may be made about locale based solely on phone numbers. Thus, if a candidate has no address info, BUT has a phone number with a 93 prefix, that candidate will be assigned a municipality of Barcelona.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.UseIndia
member.summary: Set this property to true to enable better parsing of India contact info. The default is false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.UseIreland
member.summary: Set this property to true to enable parsing of Ireland contact info. The default is false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.UseItaly
member.summary: Set this property to true to enable parsing of Italy contact info. The default is false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.UseSweden

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.CultureInfo
member.summary: Sets the default used when parsing text, numbers, dates, etc.

remarks.para: Default value is .
In cases where the output format (such as HR-XML) requires a LanguageCode but none has been identified, the value of TwoLetterISOLanguageName is used.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.RegionInfo
member.summary: Sets the default used for parsing. This affects defaults for country and currency.

remarks.para: Default value is .

summary.para: In cases where the output format requires a CountryCode (such as HR-XML postal addresses) but none has been identified, this default value is used. This value is the same as RegionInfo.TwoLetterISORegionName, which defaults to the locale selected through Regional and Language Options (or Regional Options or Regional Settings) in Control Panel in Windows. Setting this value is the same as assigning to RegionInfo, but simpler and more accessible for COM clients.
Note: This property must be a 2-letter ISO 3166 code, with one exception: for backward compatibility reasons, Sovren uses the code "UK" instead of "GB" for the United Kingdom.

In cases where the output format requires a CurrencyCode (such as HR-XML compensation) but none has been identified, this default value is used. This value is the same as RegionInfo.ISOCurrencySymbol, which defaults to the locale selected through Regional and Language Options (or Regional Options or Regional Settings) in Control Panel in Windows.
Note: This property must be an ISO 4177 code.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.DateOutputStyle
member.summary: Controls the output format, and assumptions using in parsing, for dates that do not provide the month and/or day portion of a date. See . The default is .

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.MinimumPhoneDigitCount
member.summary: Specifies the minimum number of digits permitted in a phone number in cases where there is some ambiguity about whether the value is actually a phone number. Default = 8.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.ResolutionStyleForAmbiguousTwoFactorDate
member.summary: See documentation for enumeration. Default value is AmbiguousDateHandling.DefaultPerParserSettingsAndContext.

member.name: T:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.AmbiguousDateHandling
member.summary:
Specifies how to handle ambiguous date formats. For instance, is "06-08" meant to be June of 2008, August of 2006, or 2006-2008? Similarly, what does "96-01" mean? Is it January of 1996, or is it 1996-2001?
How about "2007-8"? Is that a single year and month, or a year to year range?
Sometimes context can tell us. If we see "06-08 - 08-12", and it is currently a year that is earlier than 2012, then this must mean "August of 2006 to December of 2008". HOWEVER, if it is 2012 or later, then this could mean June of 2008 to August of 2012.
So, sometimes context can resolve the dilemma and sometimes it cannot. In addition, it is possible that the date parser was only given one date to parse, and is missing the context.
Therefore, we have this enumeration and the 'ResolutionStyleForAmbiguousDate' setting to tell the parser how to handle the ambiguities.

member.name: T:Sovren.ParserCultureSettings.DateOutputStyles
member.summary:
The Parser can output dates as 1991-01-01 format, where the month and day may be inferred. This is the default. A job date of just '1999' will therefore be given a date range of 1999-01-01 to 1999-12-31. This facilitates database storage, and provides continuity in date ranges where ther are implied. In addition, the "present" date will be output as the current date in YYYY-MM-DD style. This is the default behavior of the Parser, and is the same as setting 'DateOutputStyle' to 'InferMissingDateParts'.
Optionally, dates can be output with only explicitly known data, meaning that dates will only be reported using the information explicitly provided. Thus, a date of Nov 2000 would be reported as 2000-11, and a date of 11/11/2000 would be output as 2000-11-11, and a date of '1999' would be output as 1999, and a date of 'Present' would be output as current.
The StructuredXMLResume's RevisionDate element will be unaffected by these settings and will always be output as YYYY-MM-DD.

member.name: T:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings
member.summary: This class specifies all coverage-related settings used during parsing.

member.name: M:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.SetAll(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Set all Boolean Coverage properties to the specified value.
The primary use is to set all Coverage properties to false, so you can then explicitly set individual properties to true.
BEWARE: Setting all Coverage properties to true can adversely affect accuracy, performance, and will capture additional content in future versions as new Coverage properties are created.
member.param: The value to be assigned to each Boolean Coverage property.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.ContactInfo
member.summary: Parse for Contact Information. Default = true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.Objective
member.summary: Parse for Objective. Default = true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.ExecutiveSummary
member.summary: Parse for Executive Summary. Default = true.
member.remarks: The value is also true whenever Skills and FindSkillsInExecutiveSummary are both true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.EmploymentHistory
member.summary: Parse for Employment History. Default = true.
member.remarks: The value is also true whenever Skills or JobCatgories is true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.EmploymentHistoryRequiresDates
member.summary: When true (default), the parser only finds positions that have a date associated with them. When false, the parser first looks for positions with dates, and if none are found then the parser rescans the text without looking for dates. This additional scan can make Employment History parsing substantially slower. Since resumes typically have Position dates, the default is to require dates and avoid the additional scan. However, if you must extract Employment History from resumes that do not have Position dates, then change this setting to false. Default = true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.EntryLevel
member.summary: Set to true if you know or suspect that the resume is from an entry-level candidate with no work experience. When true, the parser relaxes its effort to find work history because entry level resumes often do not list any positions. When false (the default), the parser assumes that there is work history somewhere in the resume and so it works hard to identify some portion of the resume as work history (which can create inaccuracies when there is no work history). Default = false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.EducationHistory
member.summary: Parse for Education History. Default = true. HOWEVER, if there is a resume/CV that appears to have no education section, then if this flag has been set to 'true, training will be parsed as education without regard to the setting for Training.
member.remarks: The value is also true whenever Skills and FindSkillsInEducationHistory are both true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.LicensesAndCertifications
member.summary: Parse for Licenses and Certifications. Default = true.
member.remarks: The value is also true whenever Skills is true and either FindSkillsInCertifications or FindSkillsInLicenses is true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.Management
member.summary: Parse for Management experience. Default = true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.Skills

member.remarks: When true, EmploymentHistory is also set to true.

member.summary: Parse for Training. Training is parsed as Education, since there is no dedicated parser specifically for training and since the HR-XML Resume schema does not have a place for training. Training info is reported as UserArea/Training elements in the XML. HOWEVER, if there is a resume/CV that appears to have no Education section, then Training will be parsed into the EducationHistory without regard to this setting. Default = false.

member.summary: Add Position Titles to the list of skills. Default = false.

member.summary: Add Certifications and Licenses to the list of skills. Default = false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.AddNonTaxonomySkills
member.summary: Add non-taxonomy skills. These are skills that are not in the selected taxonomies but that appear to be skills. This is most useful when parsing a resume with the intended purpose of searching and matching skills based on freeform user-input that may include keywords that are not listed in your selected taxonomies. Default = false.

remarks.para: In the output, non-taxonomy skills have a competency id of "CALCULATED" and a parent competency id of "ALL_CALCULATED_SKILLS". They look like this in the XML output:
remarks.code: <Competency name="Treasury"> <CompetencyId id="CALCULATED" idOwner="ALL_CALCULATED_SKILLS" /> <CompetencyEvidence name="Treasury" typeDescription="Found in WORK HISTORY" typeId="CALCULATED" lastUsed="2008-07-31"> <NumericValue description="Total Months">21</NumericValue> </CompetencyEvidence> </Competency>

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserCoverageSettings.IgnoreCaseForSkills
member.summary: If you set this property to true, then the case-sensitivity rules that are specified on the individual skill defintions are ignored and the parser ignores case-sensitivity when looking for skills. Default = false.
member.remarks: As an example, the programming environment named "PROGRESS" normally appears in upper-case, so its case-sensitivity rule is set to ignore the lower case variation "progress". If you set IgnoreCaseForSkills to true, then the word "progress" will detected as the skill "PROGRESS".

member.name: T:Sovren.TelcomNumberOutputStyles
member.summary: Specifies the type of structure that is used to represent each telcom number. Used by ParserSettings.OutputFormat.TelcomNumber.
member.remarks: The integer values for this enum have been assigned to allow for future use as Flags, but currently you must select only a single value.

summary.para: Telcom number will be output as a single <FormattedNumber> element that contains the raw (unmodified) text that was extracted from the document. Numeric value = 1.
When possible, the telcom number will be output as a single <FormattedNumber> element that has been reformatted based on knowledge of the underlying structure of the number. Numeric value = 2.
This option currently only applies to US/Canada numbers. When there is insufficient information about the structure of the number, the style reverts to Raw.
When possible, the telcom number will be output as multiple elements, each containing a portion of the number (InternationalCountryCode, AreaCode, SubscriberNumber, Extension). Numeric value = 4.
This option currently only applies to US/Canada numbers. When there is insufficient information about the structure of the number, the style reverts to Raw.

member.name: T:Sovren.TelcomNumberOutputFormat
member.summary: Specifies telcom number output formatting options.

member.name: P:Sovren.TelcomNumberOutputFormat.Style
member.summary: Specifies the style to use. The default is .

member.name: T:Sovren.ContactMethodPackStyles
member.summary: Specifies the type of packing that is performed on ContactMethod elements. The HR-XML standard does not permit multiple occurences of the same type (e.g. Telephone) within a single ContactMethod. However, since this commonly occurs in documents, we offer multiple strategies for how to handle the output.

member.name: F:Sovren.ContactMethodPackStyles.Split
member.summary: Each ContactMethod will contain only a single child element. This structure provides the most robust level of information because each element can have its own distinct value for Use/Location/WhenAvailable. And it also provides a consistent approach for storing multiple values of the same type (e.g. two phone numbers that are both classified as personal/home/telephone). Numeric value = 1.

summary.para: Child elements are packed into as few ContactMethod elements as possible. Elements with the same Use/Location are merged into a common ContactMethod. When there are multiple elements of the same type/use/location, then additional ContactMethod elements are created to hold those extra values. Numeric value = 2.
Limitiations include:

item.description: Occurrences of ContactMethod/Use = "unknown" are converted to "personal"
Occurrences of ContactMethod/Use = "businessDirect" are converted to "business"
Occurrences of ContactMethod/Location other than "office" are converted to "home"
Loss of multiple values for WhenAvailable

summary.para: Same as except that all ContactMethod information will be packed into at most two ContactMethod elements. One with a Use/Location of personal/home, and the other with a Use/Location of business/office. Numeric value = 3.

WARNING: This style may cause loss of data. The HR-XML standard does not allow multiple elements of the same type in the same contact method, so if, for example, a resume contained two Home Mobile numbers, then the second number would be discarded.
Some systems (e.g. SAP eRecruitment) are not able to handle multiple ContactMethod elements, so this option exists to limit the output to a single packed ContactMethod for each Use/Location.

member.name: T:Sovren.ContactMethodOutputFormat
member.summary: Specifies output formatting options for ContactMethod elements. Used by ParserSettings.OutputFormat.ContactMethod.

member.name: P:Sovren.ContactMethodOutputFormat.PackStyle
member.summary: Specifies the style to use. The default is .

member.summary: A list of known formats. Many more formats are supported, but these particular formats require special processing.

member.name: T:Sovren.ParserInputFormatSettings
member.summary: Specifies parser input format options.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserInputFormatSettings.KnownFormat
member.summary: Specifies whether the source text is in a known format.

member.name: T:Sovren.ParserNormalizationSettings
member.summary: Specifies when and how values are normalized, such as "Florida" to "FL".

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserNormalizationSettings.NormalizeRegions
member.summary: Controls whether Region values are normalized to their standard abbreviations. When false, region values are returned exactly as they appear within the resume. When true, region values are normalized, if possible. This currently only applies to USA States and Canadian Provinces. For example, normalize the US State name "Florida" and all its variations to "FL". Default = true.

member.name: T:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings
member.summary: Specifies parser output formatting options.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.TelcomNumber
member.summary: Specifies output formatting options for TelcomNumber elements.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.ContactMethod
member.summary: Specifies output formatting options for ContactMethod elements.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.ShowParentSkills
member.summary: If true, when the Parser finds a skill, it will look up the parent skill, if any (the skill itself may be parent-level...), and will output the parent skill as well. Default = true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.NestJobsBasedOnDateRanges
member.summary: If true and if the candidate held multiple positions at the same employer, the HR-XML will show multiple position histories nested within a single EmployerOrg node. Default = true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.AssumeCompanyNameFromPrecedingJob
member.summary: If true and if a position has no nearby company name, then the parser assigns the position to the same company as the immediately preceding position. This will often be right when the applicant is very experienced but has not done a good job of writing a MACHINE-readable resume rather than a VISUAL resume. Default = false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.MinimumPositionTitleProbability
member.summary: If the PositionTitleProbability is less than this value, the position title will not be reported. Any value is valid, but only values between 0 and 20 inclusive make any sense to use. The default is 9. Any value less than 10 indicates a guess or inference. Using values greater than 10 is NOT recommended. Default = 9.
member.remarks:
Values < 10 are guesses. There is no upper bound.
9: probable
8: maybe
5: a guess
4: not likely, but our best guess
< 4: wild guess

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.MinimumCompanyNameProbability
member.summary: If the CompanyNameProbability is less than this value, the company name will not be reported. Any value is valid, but only values between 0 and 20 inclusive make any sense to use. The default is 9. Any value less than 10 indicates a guess or inference. Using values greater than 10 is NOT recommended. Default = 9.
member.remarks:
Values < 10 are guesses. There is no upper bound.
9: probable
8: maybe
5: a guess
4: not likely, but our best guess
< 4: wild guess

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.CreateBullets
member.summary: When true, the PositionHistory/UserArea will include a "bullet" based interpretation of the PositionHistory/Description text in which each significant sentence/line/paragraph is reported as a separate Bullet object or element. This can be useful when transforming HR-XML into an standard resume document format and you want each major point to be a bullet. Default = false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.EmbedResumeTextInHrXml
member.summary: When true, the converted resume text that was used for parsing will be embedded into the Resume.NonXMLResume element in the HR-XML parsed results. Default = false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.OutputCoverLetter
member.summary: When true, the cover letter text (if any) is included in the HR-XML output in the Resume/UserArea/CoverLetterText element. Only has an effect when OutputSovrenUserAreaExtensions is true. Default = true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.OutputSovrenUserAreaExtensions
member.summary: When true, output significantly useful data that is above and beyond what is specified by the HR-XML schema. This includes resume sectioning details, personal information, calculated best fit taxonomies, length of experience, management level, and so on. This data is added to UserArea elements and is HR-XML compliant. When false, only standard HR-XML data is output. Default = true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.EmbedOffsetOfLatestDataFoundMarkerIntoPositionHistoryText
member.summary: When true, a marker "[*]" is inserted after the latest place, in the position history Description text, where a piece of parsed data was found. Default = false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.StripHeaderFromPositionHistoryDescription
member.summary: By default, the PositionHistory/Description element includes all text that is related to a particular PositionHistory element, including the title, company, location and date. If you want the Description element to remove that header information and leave only the descriptive text that follows it, then set this option to true. Default = false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.ReformatPositionHistoryDescription
member.summary: By default, the PositionHistory/Description element retains as much of the original formatting as possible. Set this to true to remove blank lines, split long paragraphs into separate lines, and other reformatting techniques intended to place each achievement on a separate line. Default = false.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.SectionDetails
member.summary: Controls whether the UserArea of HR-XML output includes information about the resume sections, including: start line number, end line number, section type, section text. Default = true.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.MaximumJobObjectiveLength
member.summary:
Sometimes the JobObjective can be too lengthy. The number of characters returned in that property is limited by this setting. A value of 0 means no limit.
Default = 1000.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.UserAreaNamespace
member.summary:
Specifies the namespace prefix to use for all Sovren elements generated within HR-XML UserArea elements.
Default = sov

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.IndentChars
member.summary: When formatted XML (see is requested, this setting specifies the character(s) to be used for indentation. Default = one tab.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.BestFitTaxonomyCount
member.summary: When a TaxonomySummary is generated, this property controls the number of BestFitTaxonomy records that are output at each level. When 0, the count is unlimited. Default = 2.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserOutputFormatSettings.BestFitTaxonomyDepth
member.summary: When a TaxonomySummary is generated, this property controls how many levels of depth of BestFitTaxonomy records are reported. When 0, depth is unlimited. When 1, only the top level is reported. When 2, up to two levels are reported. Default = 2.

member.name: T:Sovren.ParserRuntimeSettings
member.summary: Controls parser runtime settings such as threading, memory, and timeouts.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserRuntimeSettings.GeneratePerformanceLog
member.summary: When true, detailed internal timing information is added to the PerformanceLog property on the ParserMapper class and to the diagnostic trace log if the trace level is at least at the Information level.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserRuntimeSettings.SoftTimeout
member.summary: The number of milliseconds before the parser should gracefully stop its work and return as much data as it had been able to gather up to that point. Set to Timeout.Infinite (-1) to have no timeout. Default = 30000 (30 seconds). Minimum = 1000 (1 second).

remarks.para: The default can be modified in the config file with this appSetting: Sovren.ParserSettings.Runtime.SoftTimeout

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserRuntimeSettings.HardTimeout
member.summary: The number of milliseconds before the parser should be forcefully terminated. The parser runs on an internally-controlled thread, and that thread is aborted when this limit is reached. All information gathered up to that point will be available, but it is possible that some of that information will be incomplete or inconsistent. Set to Timeout.Infinite (-1) to have no timeout. Default = 40000 (40 seconds). Minimum = 1000 (1 second).

remarks.para: To help ensure data consistency, the parser requires that the hard timeout is always greater than the soft timeout by at least a small margin (the lesser of 20% or 2 seconds). See the property for a more detailed explanation of the computed hard timeout value that is actually used during parsing.
The default can be modified in the config file with this appSetting: Sovren.ParserSettings.Runtime.HardTimeout

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserRuntimeSettings.EffectiveHardTimeout
member.summary: This value is the hard timeout that will be used during parsing. It is derived from the SoftTimeout and HardTimeout settings, based on a few rules to ensure that HardTimeout is never less than a small margin above SoftTimeout.

remarks.para: EffectiveHardTimeout is calculated according to several rules:

item.description: If either SoftTimeout or HardTimeout was set to Infinite, then EffectiveHardTimeout is Infinite.
EffectiveHardTimeout is the greater of A) HardTimeout or B) SoftTimeout plus an additional 20% margin (up to 2000 ms).

remarks.para: Some examples:

item.description: If SoftTimeout and HardTimeout are both 1000, then EffectiveHardTimeout is 1200 ms.
If SoftTimeout and HardTimeout are both 10000, then EffectiveHardTimeout is 12000 ms.
If either SoftTimeout or HardTimeout is Infinite, then EffectiveHardTimeout is Infinite.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserRuntimeSettings.LineCountErrorThreshold
member.summary:
The text will not be parsed if it has more than this number of lines. Use this setting to avoid parsing wayward documents. A value of 0 means no limit.
Default = 3000.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserRuntimeSettings.LineCountParseThreshold
member.summary:
Specify the maximum number of lines to be parsed from the text. The text is truncated at this threshold before parsing. This threshold helps avoid wasting valuable time parsing data of little value. A value of 0 means no limit.
Default = 1000.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserRuntimeSettings.MaxThreads
member.summary: Controls whether the Parser is allowed to use additional threads to increase performance. On machines with multiple processors or hyperthreading, additional threads can cut parsing times substantially. Default is to allow as many threads as there are processors.

remarks.para: A value of 0 means to allow as many threads as there are processors. Values less than zero are not allowed.
The default can be modified in the config file with this appSetting: Sovren.ParserSettings.Runtime.MaxThreads

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserRuntimeSettings.ThreadPriority
member.summary: Set the priority of the internal thread used to run the parser. Default = ThreadPriority.Normal.

remarks.para: By default, the Parser will run at normal priority in the operating system. Changing this setting to ThreadPriority.BelowNormal or ThreadPriority.Lowest will greatly reduce the impact of the Parser on the operating environment.

A scenario where the Parser might be set to lower priority could be when the Parser is being used as part of a desktop application and you want to ensure that the user's computing experience does not seem to bog down during parsing.
Changing the priority to a setting above ThreadPriority.Normal is unlikely to yield noticeably better parsing times and will make other applications less responsive.
The default can be modified in the config file with this appSetting: Sovren.ParserSettings.Runtime.Timeout

member.name: T:Sovren.ParserDiagnosticSettings
member.summary: Specifies the generation of diagnostic information during parsing.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserDiagnosticSettings.DebugMode
member.summary: When true, each parse is single-threaded and additional debug information is captured during parsing. Always true when both Debugger.IsAttached and environment variable SOVREN_DEBUG=TRUE.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserDiagnosticSettings.TraceFlushInterval
member.summary:
Diagnostic trace output is automatically buffered for performance. When the buffer fills it is automatically flushed. However, you may wish to view trace output before the buffer fills. This setting sets the maximum number of milliseconds between flushes. A value of 0 or less disables timed flushes.
Default = 1000 ms.
AppSetting = Sovren.ParserSettings.Diagnostic.TraceFlushInterval.

member.name: T:Sovren.ParserDataSettings
member.summary: Specifies data that is used during parsing.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserDataSettings.MinimumNonPersonalYear
member.summary: When parsing a resume/CV, it is important to set a floor for the lowest date that makes logical sense when parsing for items such as dates of employment and education. By default, this number 49 years earlier than the RevisionDate.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserDataSettings.MinimumPersonalYear
member.summary: When parsing a resume/CV, it is important to set a floor for the lowest date that makes logical sense when parsing for person dates, such as date of birth. By default this value is set at RevisionDate minus 85 years.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserDataSettings.RevisionDate
member.summary:
Specifies the revision date of the document being parsed. This date is used whenever the parser detects a reference to the current date, as in a date range like this "October 2006 to Present". This setting can be useful when parsing old resumes, so that skills and work experience calculations are not skewed by the passage of time.
Default = the current local system date (DateTime.Today).

remarks.para: This date is also reported in the <RevisionDate> element in the HR-XML.

The default value of this property within ParserSettings.Default is DateTime.MinValue. The special value of DateTime.MinValue indicates that this property should be automatically assigned the value of DateTime.Today whenever this setting is copied, such as when a new ParserSettings instance copies its default values from ParserSettings.Default or when a custom ParserSettings instance is cloned. This oddity is necessary to allow cached ParserSettings instances to be temporally correct when used today and tomorrow.
The RevisionDate cannot be set to less than January 1, 2000. In practice, this should not be an issue since a 10 year old resume is practically worthless anyway.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserDataSettings.TaxonomyFiles
member.summary:
Specifies the collection of taxonomies to use when parsing for skills. This setting is only used when TaxonomyRoots is null. If TaxonomyRoots and TaxonomyFiles are both null or empty, then the built-in language-specific TaxonomyRoot is used, if one exists, otherwise the built-in English TaxonomyRoot is used.
Default = null.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserDataSettings.SkillFiles
member.summary:
Specifies the collection of skills to use when parsing for skills. This setting is only used when TaxonomyRoots is null. If TaxonomyRoots and SkillFiles are both null or empty, then the built-in language-specific TaxonomyRoot is used, if one exists, otherwise the built-in English TaxonomyRoot is used.
Default = null.

member.name: P:Sovren.ParserDataSettings.TaxonomyRoots
member.summary:
Specifies the collection of taxonomies and skills to use when parsing for skills. If this setting is null, then the TaxonomyFiles and SkillFiles settings are used. If those are also null, then the built-in language-specific TaxonomyRoot is used, if one exists, otherwise the built-in English TaxonomyRoot is used.
Default = null.

member.summary: When true, all of the definitions in the CUSTOM_DATA_DEFINITIONS data list (based on the language setting) will be loaded and used during parsing. Default = false.

member.name: T:Sovren.FlatSkill
member.summary:
FlatSkill is a flattened (simplified, retaining all features) version of hrxmlCompetencyType, with fields for data that would be contained in CompetencyEvidences and CompetencyWeights. We no longer support the exact HR-XML Resume 2.4+ schema /inside/ these objects, as we did in the old hrxmlCompetencyType objects that the FlatSkill type replaces.
The hrxmlCompetencyType objects were too unwieldy to use for all of our complicated skills/taxonomy calculation/characterization algorithms because much of the data had to be stored in properties that were themselves hrxmlBase derived objects. The object nesting was just too deep to be practical and efficient.
Thus, we have deprecated the old hrxmlCompetencyType and hrxmlCompetency objects and replaced them with FlatSkill and FlatSkills, respectively. The names describe the difference: we flattened the objects so that there are no nested hrxmlBase-derived properties.
The GetAsXml() methods will still produce the same valid HR-XML output. SOME IMPROVEMENTS HAVE BEEN MADE TO THE OUTPUT, HOWEVER.
For instance, each skill that is a child skill will now have the CompetencyId idOwner attribute set to the SkillId of the parent skill. Parent skills will have an empty idOwner attribute. Similarly, the skill's subtaxonomy is listed as its TaxonomyId, and the top level parent taxonomy id of that subtaxonomy is listed in the TaxonomyId idOwner attribute. The description attribute is now populated with a semicolon-delimited list of ALL the resume section types where the skill was found.

member.summary: The calculated last date that the skill appears to have been in active use.

member.name: P:Sovren.FlatSkill.CumulativeMonths
member.summary: The cumulative months that the skill appears to have been in use. NOTE: This calculation can be modified by later algorithms such as some that appear in the ParserMapper class. For instance, say a candidate has three position histories, each lasting exactly 12 months during 2005, 2004, and 2003, and that the skill appears in only the first one and the last one. Further, say that it appears three times in the first one, and that it also appears in the separate skills summary section of the resume. The cumulative months reported here would be 12 + 0 + 12 + 6 = 30. However, it could be argued (speculated, actually), that the skill was in use during the middle job if it was in use before and after that job. So, the argument could be made that the correct value is 12 + 12 + 12 + 6 = 42. There is a way, in the ParserMapper class, to have that logic applied after the fact. Also, there is a way in the Parser Mapper class to change the value given to a non-date-range appearance in a non-work-history section of the resume, from the default of six months, to a different value.

The type of the item that you wish to parse for. Please use XML-legal names.
The regular expression pattern to use. Remember, all desired regular expression options (see Regex.RegexOptions in the .NET Framework) must be embedded in this pattern.

member.summary: Create a definition.
member.param: .NET Regular Expression that will match the desired data for this definition.

member.name: P:Sovren.CustomDataDefinition.Type
P:Sovren.CustomDataDefinition.Pattern
member.summary: The .NET Regular Expression pattern that matches data for this type. When null, the parser attempts to load the pattern from the CUSTOM_DATA_DEFINITIONS data list of the same language as the resume.

member.name: T:Sovren.CustomDataDefinitionCollection
member.summary:
Holds a collection of customer-defined definitions that will gather custom data items during parsing. Currently, these definitions use regular expressions.
================================================================
WARNING: Most regular expressions are safe, but it is possible to write an expressions that perform poorly and some that even behave like an infinite loop, in which case the parser will appear to hang. You must stress test your expressions to ensure that they do not hang.
================================================================
Add new definitions by calling . After parsing is done, you can retrieve data from the parser.Resume.UserArea.CustomData.Matches property or in the HR-XML at Resume/UserArea/ResumeUserArea/CustomData/CustomDataItem.

member.name: M:Sovren.CustomDataDefinitionCollection.AddDefinition(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a definition that has already been defined in the CUSTOM_DATA_DEFINITIONS data list.
member.param: The name of the item that you wish to parse for. Please use XML-legal names.

member.name: M:Sovren.CustomDataDefinitionCollection.AddDefinition(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a definition to be used during parsing.
member.param: The name of the item that you wish to parse for. Please use XML-legal names.
The regular expression pattern to use. All desired regular expression options (see Regex.RegexOptions in the .NET Framework) must be embedded in this pattern.

member.name: M:Sovren.FlatSkills.AddOrUpdate(Sovren.TaxonomySkill,Sovren.SkillsSection,System.String)
member.summary: If the skill does not already appear in the list (based on SkillId, not SkillName), then it will be added. Otherwise, the data will be updated.
member.param: A TaxonomySkill instance that was used to find this skill.
A SkillsSection instance describing where this skill was found in the resume.

Some TaxonomySkill instances have regular expressions rather than skill names. These skills' names start with REGEX. Because the skill name is really not a name but a regular expression, it is desireable to pass in the actual skill found by the regular expression, and this is where that should be passed.
